summary: Async task declaration order in PHP SDK workflows affects execution flow incorrectly. When tasks are declared in different orders, a workflow's main async task may be rejected instead of completing successfully, depending on the order of nested async declarations.
userImpact: Developers writing workflows with multiple async tasks cannot reliably control execution flow as it depends on arbitrary declaration order rather than logical semantics.
rootCause: Workflow::await() does not resolve/reject correctly, causing the main async to be incorrectly rejected even when internal async tasks are canceled.
proposedFix: Fix Workflow::await() to properly handle resolution and rejection states regardless of task declaration order.
workaround: Ensure consistent declaration order and avoid depending on the result of the main async task.
resolutionDetails: Issue identified as problem with Workflow::await() resolution/rejection logic. Fix was scheduled to be released the following week.
keyQuote: The problem is with `Workflow::await()`. It doesn't resolve/reject correctly. Thus the main async becomes rejected.
